item.title: jQCon ’11: SF Bay Area – Panel Q & A
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: Listen in on the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area Conference Panel Discussion that was held at the end of the conference. Ralph Whitbeck moderates a panel of team members, John Resig, Richard Worth, Adam Sontag, Dan Heberden, Leah Silber and Scott Jehl as they answer questions from the audience. You can subscribe to [...]
item.content:encoded:
Listen in on the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area Conference Panel Discussion that was held at the end of the conference. Ralph Whitbeck moderates a panel of team members, John Resig, Richard Worth, Adam Sontag, Dan Heberden, Leah Silber and Scott Jehl as they answer questions from the audience.

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

item.title: jQCon ’11: SF Bay Area – jQuery UI Keynote
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: This week we bring you the jQuery UI Keynote given by Richard Worth at the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area. Rich presents the state of jQuery UI as well as provide a preview into the new Grid control project. You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed [...]
item.content:encoded:
This week we bring you the jQuery UI Keynote given by Richard Worth at the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area. Rich presents the state of jQuery UI as well as provide a preview into the new Grid control project.


You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

item.title: jQuery 1.5 – 1.6.1
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: We talk with jQuery Core Team Member on the bug triage team, David Methvin about the last few jQuery released. We discuss the bug triage team, how to get involved and the new features of the last few releases. Links mentioned on the show bugs.jquery.com Nightly build of jquery Extending Ajax Documentation Using Deferreds in [...]
item.content:encoded:
We talk with jQuery Core Team Member on the bug triage team, David Methvin about the last few jQuery released. We discuss the bug triage team, how to get involved and the new features of the last few releases.

Links mentioned on the show

  • bugs.jquery.com
  • Nightly build of jquery
  • Extending Ajax Documentation

    • Using Deferreds in jQuery – Eric Hynds

  • window.mozRequestAnimationFrame

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

item.title: RewardJS
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: This week we take a look at the RewardJS project that Richard D. Worth has put together. RewardJS is a campaign to reward developers that fix bugs in a open source project with daily, weekly and a monthly prize for the most bugs fixed. The content is already a week and a half old but [...]
item.content:encoded:
This week we take a look at the RewardJS project that Richard D. Worth has put together. RewardJS is a campaign to reward developers that fix bugs in a open source project with daily, weekly and a monthly prize for the most bugs fixed. The content is already a week and a half old but there is still plenty of time to jump in and win a prize. Prizes already have included, XBox 360, Wii, iPad 2, Apple MacBook Air and many more. This month the campaign is targeting jQuery UI bugs.

Links from the show…

  • RewardJS
  • jQuery UI

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

Todd Parker and Scott Jehl of Filament Group give us the state of jQuery Mobile plus go over the framework at a beginner level. Next week we will bring you the jQuery UI keynote. Links from the [...]
item.content:encoded:
This week we bring you the jQuery Mobile keynote from the jQuery Conference 2011: San Francisco Bay Area. Todd Parker and Scott Jehl of Filament Group give us the state of jQuery Mobile plus go over the framework at a beginner level. Next week we will bring you the jQuery UI keynote.

item.title: jQCon ’11: SF Bay Area – jQuery Keynote
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: We’re back! From the recent jQuery Conference in the San Francisco Bay Area on April 16th and 17th we bring you the audio of the jQuery Keynote given by John Resig. Follow along in the slides that are posted below. Next week we’ll bring you the jQuery Mobile keynote. Links from the show… Slides from [...]
item.content:encoded:
We’re back! From the recent jQuery Conference in the San Francisco Bay Area on April 16th and 17th we bring you the audio of the jQuery Keynote given by John Resig. Follow along in the slides that are posted below. Next week we’ll bring you the jQuery Mobile keynote.

Links from the show…

  • Slides from the keynote

item.title: Wijmo
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: In this episode we talk with Chris Bannon of ComponentOne who talks to us about the new jQuery UI library called Wijmo. Wijmo is a collection of 29 widgets that build off of and extend jQuery UI. Wijmo just released version 1.0 of the library, take a listen and check them out. We also learn [...]
item.content:encoded:
In this episode we talk with Chris Bannon of ComponentOne who talks to us about the new jQuery UI library called Wijmo. Wijmo is a collection of 29 widgets that build off of and extend jQuery UI. Wijmo just released version 1.0 of the library, take a listen and check them out. We also learn that Chris is the organizer of the Pittsburgh jQuery Meetup group and we find out more about it.

Links from the show…

  • Wijmo
  • jQuery Pittsburgh Meetup
  • Wijmo 1.0 has landed

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

item.title: jQuery Mobile
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: We continue our discussion with John Resig this week and talk about the alpha release of jQuery Mobile. We discuss about expectations in this release and the current features. If you want to contribute to the jQuery Mobile project we outline how to do that as well. Finally we talk with Christopher Schmitt about the [...]
item.content:encoded:
We continue our discussion with John Resig this week and talk about the alpha release of jQuery Mobile. We discuss about expectations in this release and the current features. If you want to contribute to the jQuery Mobile project we outline how to do that as well. Finally we talk with Christopher Schmitt about the upcoming jQuery Summit online conference coming up on November 16th and 17th.

Links from the show…

  • jQuery Mobile
  • jQuery Summit

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

item.title: jQuery 1.4.3
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: John Resig joins us this week to talk about the lastest jQuery release, 1.4.3. We go over some of the performance improvements, the CSS method rewrite, new data method additions amongst others. Find out everything you need to know about this release right here. Also find out details about how to get started testing the [...]
item.content:encoded:
John Resig joins us this week to talk about the lastest jQuery release, 1.4.3. We go over some of the performance improvements, the CSS method rewrite, new data method additions amongst others. Find out everything you need to know about this release right here. Also find out details about how to get started testing the 1.4.4 RC.

Links from the show…

  • jQuery 1.4.3 Release Notes
  • jQuery 1.4.3 API Documentation
  • jQuery Rotate Plugin
  • jQuery 1.4.4 RC 1

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.

item.title: Ben Nadel
item.dc:creator: Ralph Whitbeck
item.description: Fresh off the jQuery Conference 2010: Boston, we sit down with Ben Nadel and talk about the conference. Ben tells us about what he learned and tells us about the awesome photo he got with the jQuery Community. Ben’s a jQuery spokesperson for the Cold Fusion community and we talk about that as well. Links [...]
item.content:encoded:
Fresh off the jQuery Conference 2010: Boston, we sit down with Ben Nadel and talk about the conference. Ben tells us about what he learned and tells us about the awesome photo he got with the jQuery Community. Ben’s a jQuery spokesperson for the Cold Fusion community and we talk about that as well.


Links from the show…

  • Ben Nadel Blog
  • Photo: Ben and Ralph on his Blog
  • Photo: Ben and the jQuery Community
  • Photo: Ben and Rey on his Blog
  • Pub/Sub – Publication/Subscribe
  • jQuery 1.4.3
  • jQuery Mobile
  • Rey’s Dancing
  • Wijmo jQuery UI Widgets

You can subscribe to the show in iTunes or via the raw RSS feed or you can download the MP3.
